content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Chandler, Monica, Phoebe, and Joey are there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Wait a minute, wait. You’re telling me this actress person is the only woman you ever wanted who didn’t want you back?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! Oh my God! (to Chandler) Is this what it’s like to be you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Wow, you’re really crazy about her, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you have no idea. And-and when we’re on stage I get to-to kiss her and-and touch her, but then she goes home with the director, and it’s like somebody’s ripping out my heart!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, it’s so great to see you feeling like this!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Monica, uh Dad called this morning and ah, Aunt Silvia passed away.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes!! Yes! Yeah, yeah, yeah!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: We were all pretty shaken up about it.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wait, am I missing something though? ‘Cause I thought death was something that’s supposed to be sad, in a way.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well ah, Aunt Silvia was, well not a nice person.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, she was a cruel, cranky, old bitch! (Ross gives her a look) (to Ross) And I’m sorry she died. Did Dad say I get the dollhouse?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You get the dollhouse.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I get the dollhouse!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow, a house for dolls, that is so cool! When I was kid, I had a barrel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Uh, Pheebs, you had a barrel for a dollhouse?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, just a barrel.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Y’know what, you can play with my dollhouse.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really?! Really?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Any time you want. Y’know, when I was younger, all I wanted to do was to play with this dollhouse, but no!! It was to be looked at, but never played with.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: My Grandmother used to say that exact same thing to me.

content.description: Rachel’s office, Chandler and her are coming back from lunch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey, Sophie!

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Hey, Rach!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thanks for lunch, Chandler. Y’know, you didn’t have to walk me all the way back up here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, that’s-that’s okay, no problem. (He starts to look around her office.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey um, honey, you do realise that we don’t keep the women’s lingerie here in the office?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I realise that.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Summer catalogue! (hands him the catalogue)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s the stuff! (quickly grabs it)
[Rachel’s boss, Joanna, enters]

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Rachel, I need the Versachi invoice. (to Chandler) Hello! You don’t work for me.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing (to Chandler) Joanna.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Bing! That’s a great name.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Thanks, it’s ah, Gaelic, for ‘Thy turkey’s done.’ So ah, I’m gonna go, nice, nice meeting you.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Me too.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Bye, Chandler.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: So ah, what’s wrong with him?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, nothing, he’s just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice it anymore.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No!! No! He’s not married, or involved, with anyone!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh, Rachel, (pause) actually, y’know what, forget it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I’ll ask him for you, if you want me too?

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and y’know something that Sophie would do?

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Uh, uh, uh, I am here.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: I know that.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica is showing off her new dollhouse. It’s a huge dollhouse, that takes up the entire living room table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpaper’s a little faded, that’s okay. Carpet’s a little loose. Hardwood floors!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It’s so beautiful.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I know!!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So, I’m here, ready to play.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha. (She removes this large ceramic dog that comes up to the second floor and places it next to the house.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: That’s a dog, every house should have a dog.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Not one that can pee on the roof.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, maybe it’s so big because the house was built on radioactive waste.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And is this in case the house sneezes?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, no, that’s the ghost for the attic.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I don’t want a ghost.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you’ve got one, because the house is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient Indian burial ground? That would never happen.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, obviously you don’t know much about the U.S. government.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I need to talk to you!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sure, what’s up?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I know. Well if something comes up… (walks away)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, I’m glad you guys are past that little awkward phase.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about you…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checkin’ out the Chan-Chan man!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That was (pause) surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you interested at all?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I’ll do it.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she’s gonna love me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the house!! Ahh-ahh! (the dinosaur starts attacking the house. She starts to bark like a dog.) Roof! Rrroof-roof-roof!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay, Phoebe, y’know what? That-that’s it, that’s it, all right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They’re not the right size, they’re not Victorian, and they just don’t go.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Okay, (starts to pack up her stuff) fine. Come dinosaur, we’re not welcome in the house of no imagination.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Uh, Pheebs, while we’re hovering around the subject. I just have to say dinosaurs, they-they don’t go, rrroof!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The little ones do.

content.description: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are getting ready to rehearse the play.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, Kate!

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Morning.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last week…

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute! (she goes over to him)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was good, yeah…

content.speaker: Woman
content.text: Hi, oh, I’m Lauren, Kate’s understudy.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: I know! I-I’m a big fan of yours.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives .

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Get out of here, really?!

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Absolutely!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah?

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: They gave me the shaft all right.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Oh, you’re so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing after rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well Ahh, (he sees Kate and the director kissing) yeah! Yeah, sure, a drink sounds great.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Cool! I-I’ll see you then.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right.

content.speaker: Director
content.text: All right, it’s time to act, my talking props. (Both Joey and Kate just look at each other.)

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is entering with her own dollhouse, that she made herself.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: All
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look, look! (She lifts up the roof, and the front panel falls revealing the interior.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, what’s this?!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, okay, it’s the slide instead of stairs. Watch this. (She slides a doll down the slide)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: It’s very interesting, Phoebe.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What’s this?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come over, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: This is the coolest house ever!!
(Monica is looking on with a hurt expression on her face.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room? (lights some incense)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I would!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Uh-huh.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Watch, watch. (She turns a strand of Christmas lights strung around the house.)

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Ooohhhh!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: And, and! (She turns on a bubble maker.)

content.speaker: Ross and Rachel
content.text: Ahhhh!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey, my Father’s house does that!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there’s nothing like a cool, crisp New York evening.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Of course, I didn’t get to enjoy any of that, because Joanna’s such a big, dull dud !

content.description: Rachel’s office, Joanna’s telling Rachel, her side of the story.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Chandler is fantastic!!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What?!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh God, we just clicked! Y’know how people just click? Like he came by to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh, and he’s got such a good heart! Doesn’t he have a good heart?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh, I know…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Oh, I know and he’s soo sweet! Listen, he said he was going to call, so put him straight through.

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Isn’t this great?!

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Don’t spoil it.

content.description: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?
[A phone rings.]

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Hello. Oh! It’s you. Just ah, just one-one sec. (to Joey and Kate) I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, committing to the moment ! (He goes to take the call.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: That guy’s like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater you’re dating.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, I’m not interested in her sweater! It’s what’s underneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who I’m going out with?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I don’t care. Why, do you want me to care?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Do you want me to want you to care?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Do you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Okay, I’m afraid to say this, but let’s pick it up where we left off.
[They resume rehearsing.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I’ve got no reason to stay.
(Joey grabs her and kisses her.)

content.speaker: Director
content.text: Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a terrible play! I’ll see you in the morning. (exits)

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: I can’t believe we go on in, in a week.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey, it’s gonna be all right.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Hey! So since we’re getting off early, do you want to go and paint mugs?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: You know! At the place I told you about last night?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah, y’know what, I think I kinda need to work on my stuff tonight.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Oh, okay.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay. (he gives her a peck on the cheek)

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: I’ll see you tomorrow. (she kisses him full on the mouth.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Okay.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: G’night. (exits)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ah, are you okay?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we gonna do about this scene, huh?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: How do you mean?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Well, Adrian’s looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can’t just kiss her, he’s gotta, gotta really give her a reason, y’know?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Maybe he could slip her the tongue.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his waist.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his stomach!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and, and, and bite her!

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this raw, animal…
[cut to Joey’s bedroom, Joey and Kate are emerging from under the covers.]

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Something like that?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Yeah, that’s pretty much what I had in mind.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross and Monica are eating breakfast as Joey enters, very happily.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.
(He walks up behind Monica and gives her a big hug and a kiss on the neck.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.
(He walks over behind Ross, thinks about it for a moment, and gives him a big hug.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s a little early to be drinkin’.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ohhhhh!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: You’re kidding?! That’s great!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, it was so amazing. After the (pause) love making…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming ‘cause, ‘cause her eyes keep going like this. (He closes his eyes and moves them around, kinda like he’s been processed by the devil, or something.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m telling ya, Joanna’s got it all wrong. Okay? All I said was, ‘This was fun. Let’s do it again sometime. I’ll give you a call.’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ohh, gee. I wonder why she thinks you’re going to call her?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s what you say at the end of a date.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You can’t just say, ‘Nice to meet you, good night?’

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To her face? Look it’s the end of the date, I’m standing there, I know all she’s waiting for is for me to say ‘I’ll call her’ and it’s just y’know, comes out. I can’t help it, it’s a compulsion.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Come on Rach, when a guy says he’s going to call, it doesn’t mean he’s going to call. Hasn’t it ever happened to you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, they always called.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hmm, bite me.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Did he call?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. Sorry.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Why?! Why?! He said he’d call. Why hasn’t he called?

content.speaker: Sophie
content.text: Maybe he’s intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn’t he called, Rachel? Why?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you are my boss.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn’t tell him not to call me, did you?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: No. I…

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you work for, there are always ways to fix…that.

content.description: Central Perk, Chandler is reading a magazine as Rachel approaches.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Call her! Call her now!
content.parenthetical: grabbing the magazine out of his hands

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Multiple, so many paper cuts.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Why hasn’t he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don’t understand. Why? He said he’ll call. Why? Why? Chandler I’m telling you she has flipped out, she’s gone crazy!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh, well give me the phone then.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Come on, this isn’t funny. She thinks it’s my fault that you haven’t called her. You have to call her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, you can’t call somebody after this long just to say, ‘In case you didn’t notice, I don’t like you!’

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well then you’re going to have to take her out again.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Nooo!! She’s really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop thing in the corner of her eye!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I don’t care! I don’t care! You are going to have to take her out again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it’s actually ended. And, I don’t care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right! Fine! But it’s just a lunch date, no more than an hour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don’t want you setting me up with anybody ever again!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: That’s fine!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: That’s just a lot of big talk, y’know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Ross is entering.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Mon?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m in the shower!

[He closes the door and walks over to get something from the fridge. He starts to smell something and turns around to see Phoebe’s dollhouse smoking. He runs over and takes off the roof to reveal that the dollhouse fire.]

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, fire! There, there’s a fire! Fire!!

[He tries to blow it out, and obviously, it doesn’t work. He runs over to the sink to get a glass of water to put out the fire, but since Monica is in the shower the water pressure is very low and takes a long time to fill the glass. In desperation he takes the half full glass over and dumps it on the fire, it doesn’t work. He then picks up the dollhouse and considers bringing it over to the sink, but decides to take it into the bathroom and use the shower to put it out. He kicks open the door and we hear Monica scream at the top of her lungs.]

content.description: The Theatre, Kate is arriving for rehearsal.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Hi.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: So I ah, talked to Lauren, kinda told her how things were with us. Did you ah, did you talk to Marshall?

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: About what?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know, about what happened with us.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Nooo. And there’s really no reason he should find out, so ah let’s not make a big deal about it, okay?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you can’t tell me last night didn’t mean something to you. I-I was there, you’re not that good an actress.

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That’s all it was. Joey, I’m-I’m sorry you feel bad, but haven’t you ever sleep with a women where it meant more to her than it did to you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Nooo.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Hi, Kate!

content.speaker: Kate
content.text: Hi, Lauren.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hi, Lauren.

content.speaker: Lauren
content.text: Hi, pig!

content.description: Monica and Rachel’s, Monica and Ross are inspecting the damage to the dollhouse.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, that’s okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower massager.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I tried to reach you at work. There’s…been a fire.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What?! Oh my… (sees the remains of the house) Oh my God!! What happened?!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, we believe it originated here. (He uses a pointer and points to the point of origin.) In the Aroma Room.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: All right. Did everyone get out okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, the giraffe’s okay. And so is the pirate.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh. What is this? (She sees a tissue covering something, and moves to remove it.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No Phoebe, don’t look! You don’t want to see what’s under there!!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ohh, the-the Foster puppets!
content.parenthetical: She pauses to ready herself, and removes the tissue.

content.text: (She picks up a charred piece of plastic that once was the Foster puppets, and starts to break down. Monica goes over and comforts her.)

content.description: Rachel’s office, Chandler and Joanna are returning from their lunch date. He is telling her about her mascara problem. Rachel is already there.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: It’s not a big deal. It’s, just it’s right here, (points to his eye) and it’s all the time.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Well, thanks again for lunch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, this, this was pleasant.
content.parenthetical: He looks over at Rachel, who nods her head

content.text: (Rachel is slowing trying to leave and let them talk.)

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: It was, wasn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: The food there was, was great.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Wasn’t it?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So take care.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: You too.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well, this was great. I’ll give you a call. We should do it again sometime. (Rachel is disappointed)

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Great! I’m looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Sophie’s desk.
(Chandler starts to leave ashamed of himself, but Rachel stops him in the hallway.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler!! Are you gonna call her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Noo!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Chandler!!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, I’m sorry. Okay? I’m weak, and pathetic, and sorry.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Okay, you are going to tell her and you’re going to tell her now. (She grabs his nipple and starts to twist it.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Ahhhh—I’m not going to call you.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m sorry. I’m-I’m-I’m sorry that I said I was going to when I’m not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, y’know? And this isn’t Rachel’s fault. It’s me. I have serious, serious problems when it comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy, (pause) mascara goop. And I’m really sorry, it’s just that this is not, this isn’t going to work out.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: Well, this isn’t how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I have to appreciate your honesty.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yeah, o-okay.

content.speaker: Joanna
content.text: So…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Well this is great! I’ll give you a call! We should do it again sometime!
(Rachel is shocked, and holds her arms out in disbelief.)

content.description: Chandler and Joey’s, Joey is talking on the phone.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Well, so anyway Beth, what I’m saying is I should’ve considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I’ve ah, I’ve recently learned what’s it like to be on your side of it, and I’m sorry. So, do you think you can forgive me? (listens) Great. Thanks. Okay, bye. (He sits down and crosses out something, and dials the phone again.) Hello, Jennifer? (listens) Oh hi, Mrs. Loreo, is Jennifer there? (listens) Oh, she’s not home huh? (listens) Well ah, actually I kinda need to talk to you too.
